file_content.text: You took out a contract?
That's one part of your problem taken care of.
I understand there's now enough information to go after the casino owner.
Here's Arkan for you. I don't think he'll provide much competition for you anymore.
Yes, that's me--Otheros, owner of the Haven's Blaze casino.
I'm concerned about the "debt facilitators" hired by the Lucky Runner casino. They're nothing more than gangsters. Street scum--like their boss.
I'm tired of people thinking we're all criminals. The Haven's Blaze is a legitimate establishment; what's more, these thugs are killing our potential customers!
Rest assured they won't be conducting business much longer.
Not anymore.
By the time I'm through, there won't be a single "facilitator" left breathing.
They're as good as dead.
Sounds like you're looking to eliminate the competition, if you ask me.
I question your motives.
Happy to hear it.
I didn't say they need to die--but if that's how it has to be done....
Competition only makes me work harder. I welcome competition. This is entirely different.
I've taken the liberty of compiling a list of the places one might find these brutes--nowhere respectable, to be certain.
Now, please excuse me; I'm quite busy.
I have one of your "facilitators" for you.
Wonderful! Glad there's plenty of space in the casino vault.
Oh, my. Must have put up a fight. Not surprising.
Credits well spent. Thank you.
Yes. Your activities have left Arkan vulnerable--well, vulnerable enough to be found, at any rate. He's still quite a danger.
Arkan was raised on the streets. Slaughtered his way into the Lucky Runner, then all the way to the top.
Now he tries to pass himself off as a wealthy businessman like myself, but he's nothing like me. He's a monster.
Where do I start looking?
I know exactly where to find him. I have the coordinates and everything.
With the other ones, I admit I had some trouble with the idea that they might be killed because of me. But with Arkan, I'd prefer it.
Arkan will never pose a problem for you or your casino again.
So you didn't kill him after all? Just as well, I suppose--I'd been meaning to find a new work of art for my office.
I'll call it "Arkan in Carbonite". It can serve as a reminder to my employees not to press their luck with me. Heh....
So he's dead? He's really dead.
Even though it's what I wanted, I thought I'd feel some sort of remorse over his death. I don't.
Thanks for this. It's really opened my eyes. Arkan may have been onto something after all....
